dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: FAITH IS A JOURNEY TOWARD HOME

cognitieve_implicaties: The hearer feels a sense of belonging and distance simultaneously.
theologische_implicaties: The world is not the ultimate reality; eschatological tension.
ethische_implicaties: Engagement without assimilation; loving neighbors while maintaining distinct values.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Could lead to a 'ghetto' mentality or a sense of superiority over 'citizens'.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the dead metaphor of 'exile' by using the contemporary legal framework of 'resident aliens' and 'green cards'.

cognitieve_implicaties: Heaven is understood as the relief of a long-standing ache.
theologische_implicaties: Total Depravity is mapped as 'misfitting' the world.
ethische_implicaties: Patience with current suffering as 'temporary hotel' living.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Heaven might be viewed as mere personal comfort rather than God's glory.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Uses a highly relatable, embodied experience (traveling/sleeping) to explain abstract eschatology.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon is anchored in the 'EXILE/HOME' schema. Every sub-metaphor (resident alien, pilgrim, bed, Jesus as exile) serves the central tension of being 'in but not of' the world.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Jesus is framed as the 'Ultimate Exile' who was 'cast out' (sacrificed) to bring the 'aliens' home.

sterktes.beschrijving: Transforms the biblical 'exile' into the modern 'resident alien' with a green card.
sterktes.voorbeeld: You have what we call a green card. You’re part of society... but you’re still not a citizen.

sterktes.beschrijving: Connects the abstract 'longing for God' to the physical 'longing for one's own bed'.
sterktes.voorbeeld: There is no bed like your bed... Home is where everything fits.

risicos.beschrijving: Mapping heaven primarily to 'comfort' and 'fitting' might obscure the holiness/judgment of God.
risicos.voorbeeld: Ultimate, real home would be a place in which everything fit the deepest longings of your soul.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view God as a means to personal satisfaction.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A globalized world of travel, passports, and NYC professional life.
sub_worlds: The Ancient Near East (Abraham, Egypt, Babylon)
The domestic space of a bedroom
The battlefield of Middle-earth (Lord of the Rings)

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; uses the 'courage' of a hobbit to map onto the 'courage' of a believer.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Reinforces that dissatisfaction is a sign of being on the right path, not a failure of faith.

verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: Critical Engagement (One foot in, one foot out).

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits the post-Easter 'Resurrection Life' series by defining the 'now but not yet' nature of the Kingdom.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in CMT. It takes the abstract concept of 'Christian Identity' and maps it onto the concrete experience of 'Immigration' and 'Domestic Comfort'. The dominant landscape is one of movement and belonging, successfully avoiding the 'Military' domain's potential for violence while maintaining the 'Relational' domain's warmth.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the source domain by describing the visceral reality of ancient sacrificial rituals to contrast with the 'clean' legal metaphors used elsewhere.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The warmth and cost of the life-liquid that marks a doorpost.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The shift from 'Resident Alien' (Legal) to 'Bed' (Physical Comfort).
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Bridge these by emphasizing that a 'Resident Alien' never feels 'physically' at ease in the host culture's 'furniture'.

entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Remind the hearer that this 'possession' is an active 'priesthood' (as the text says) to avoid passivity.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To balance the 'urban' feel of NYC/passports with the 'scattered seed' (diaspora) imagery of the text.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The use of CMT to bridge 1st-century 'exile' with 21st-century 'resident alien' status is homiletically brilliant and cognitively sticky.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: An aesthetic analysis would praise the 'bed' story for its charm; CMT reveals it as a vital mapping of eschatological 'fit'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Kolb would focus on the 'experience' of the traveler; CMT focuses on the 'conceptual structure' that experience provides for understanding God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher is using 'Spatial/Verticality' schemas (outside the gate, one foot in) to solve 'Identity' problems.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: One foot in, one foot out
appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'HOME IS A HABITABLE BUILDING' and 'LIFE IS A JOURNEY' metaphors.
